value.0: Hello there!
Of course... what do you like to know?
Visit the Mapmaker near the North Gate, <Sir/Madam>.

Nightingale travelled to Amia to assist with the care of the Plague victims. On arrival she found that the Undead of this region posed far more of a threat than those of Dale Hollow did so she stayed to offer her abilities as an Undead Hunter.

The temple she built focuses on ridding the island of undead as well as aiding the wounded during and after battles. The clerics are Neutral or Good in alignment only and their creed is that an injured person will recieve aid, regardless of alignment.

The small community of Eilistraeen drow in Amia call this place their second and in many cases first home. With few primary exports or imports the Shrine is a self-sufficient entity watched over by house Kenlyl.

All are welcome as long as they do no harm and the Shrine would never turn away any good person in need of aid. Founded years ago by Vikii D'Vreeze the Shrine is testament to her faith and power. She set the stones that are at the shrines heart and hallowed the ground so evil outsiders and undead would find the very ground uncomfortable to walk on. While Matron Vikii is long gone the Shrine remains as a symbol of Eilistraee and a refuge for drow who reject the ways of evil.

Wyrmhold, once called Stonehold, came to be when the ancestors of the Mylocks, the Mynocks, built a large and grand civilization on the island. However, with the rise of the Elves into the nearby Moonshae Islands, the Mynocks fell into ruin and disrepair, and over time the Mynocks de-evolved into the nearly-mindless Mylocks.

A devil named Bul’zeelab took residency in Stonehold and held it until a new leader emerged and worked this devil in partnership. This man’s name was Revan and he gathered a large army of individuals from all over the island and waged war with Benwick constantly until his final defeat.

Stonehold fell silent for years, until Drak’Law and Layla Emberblaze took residency. Tension built up between Bul'zeelab and the Emberblazes, until Bul’zeelab was finally killed by a servant of the Emberblaze's army. They changed the name to Wyrmhold and crushed Benwick in one fell blow, thus sealing their claim to power. 

Now Wyrmhold itself lies in ruin. The irony!

Zanshibon was once a very corrupt city that exists elsewhere than on Amia island (the only way to reach it was through the portal in Mystra’s Grove). It harbored a very decadent society that slaked anyone and everyone’s carnal and material lusts to their heart’s desire. It was banished from the world into the Abyss. The city now exists as a scornful mockery of what it was.

Wharftown was formed as a fishing village and remains so to this day. It has frequently been attacked by pirates of Umberlee. Several years ago, Umberlee herself assisted these pirates in an attempt to find an artifact supposedly hidden somewhere in the village. With help from the Priestesses of Selune, who had just made residence at that time, adventurers were able to track down the pirates and destroy their lair.

Wharftown was later taken under the wing of Wyrmhold and is now considered a satellite territory.

Benwick came to be after King Galahad and his loyal court built it where the Temple of Salandra now stands.  After the Duke was chased from power, one Cordorian requested the Seneschal of Benwick for aid. Benwick occupied Cordor as an interim government. Benwick helped to found the Council of Cordor and pulled out afterwards.

Benwick slowly fell into disuse after Galahad’s original court refused to recruit any new members. Over time, it became abandoned, and Galahad himself left the castle. Eventually, Gabriel Judicator was granted, permission to hold the castle as Steward until the rightful King returned. For a small time, Benwick was once again moving towards the glory it once held. 

King Galahad soon returned when he learned that Benwick was being revived and retook his throne. His court soon followed. In a shameful display, King Galahad’s court cast all of those who brought the life back into the forgotten old castle. Benwick quickly fell into disuse again, and Wyrmhold eventually destroyed it.

Kohlingen is a city founded by Lord Darius Tristam after he split away from the Knights of Benwick over a disagreement on ethics and morals. For many years, the Kholingen Defenders prospered under his name and became a righteous city, often called the 'City of Paladins'. Over time, it became a major trading port and safe haven for all those of good heart.

Lord Darius Tristam eventually left the city and the Defenders leaving a priest named Kenji to lead the defenders. Over time, they drifted away, until a Drow female named Celene Nai'lo requested from the Justicar to revive them. He granted it, and the Defenders were reborn. They exist to this day. Celene Nai'lo eventually left the island herself. The Imperator now lives there since the fall of Benwick.

The city of Cordor, like most cities, started off as a small villiage. It lay along the southern coastline of the island known as Amia. The town, mainly was upkept by fishermen until one day, a wrecked and battered ship carrying a group of refugees found port there. The townsfolk welcomed the newcomers to the city and together this generation carved out the roads, and lands that would one day be the city that it is today.

In the coming years, more boats arrived. Passengers included refugees, outcasts, and misfits from various different places in the world seeking somewhere they could truely belong. This lead to the widespread tolerance of many races and types within the city. To this day it is not uncommon to see drow, elves, humans, goblins, and fey regard one another.
Thank you!
